alert.note: Alert for Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 12:28PM EST until January 14 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Central Chester County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 100 PM EST. * At 1228 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near King Of Prussia to near Cochranville, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 320 and 325. Locations impacted include... West Chester, Downingtown, Kennett Square, Paoli, Marshallton, Valley Forge, King Of Prussia, West Goshen, Malvern, South Coatesville, Modena, Exton, Chesterbrook, Devon-Berwyn, and Thorndale. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
